results.title: The Taste of others = It takes all kinds = Le Gout des autres
results.creator_credit: Les Films A4, France2 Cinema, Telema Productions, Canal+, Christian Berard, Charles Gassot and Agnes Jaoui
results.brief_description: This comedy, about the foibles of a disparate group of people whose lives intersect and are altered in unforseen ways, has a whimsical tone that is underpinned by an impressively deft script. Jean-Jacques Castella is a depressed industrialist married to an interior designer who dominates their personal spaces with her ‘taste’. Their unstable marriage cataclysmically implodes when Jean-Jacques attends a bourgeois play (against his will) subsequently falling in love with an aging actress. Clara for her part takes an immediate dislike to Jean-Jacques - considering him a materialistic, middle-class, tasteless bore. Added to this mix is Jean-Jacques’ bodyguard, who falls in with a free-spirited barmaid; his driver, coping with the trials of a long distance love affair; and Clara’s cultured friends who delight in mocking the gauche and unknowing Jean-Jacques. Thus whilst interrogating notions of class and taste, this comedy of manners is also a humanistic and wry portrayal of modern relationships, mores and ways. In her debut feature Agnes Jaoui ably captures the idiosyncrasies and muddled desires of her protagonists, without stooping to bland characterisations or pat conclusions. A contender for Best Foreign Film at the Academy Awards, “The Taste of others” won four Cesars (including Best Film) and was nominated for a further five. Cast includes Jean-Pierre Bacri, Anne Alvaro, Agnes Jaoui, Gerard Lanvin, Alain Chabat, Brigitte Catillon, Christiane Millet and Vladimir Yordanoff.

results.title: The Tasmanian tiger
results.creator_credit: Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production, Linda Taylor and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: Two tourists in search of Tasmania’s Thylacine or marsupial tiger, now probably extinct, see most of the island’s native animals in a zoo. Contains rare archival footage of a Tasmanian tiger in captivity and extensive footage of the Tasmanian devil.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production, Linda Taylor and Don Anderson

results.title: The Task before the building industry
results.brief_description: A survey of the task of building still facing Britain - as a result of war-time destruction and also of modern progress in social standards. Millions of new houses, schools and public and private buildings and structures of all kinds are needed to replace the bombed and the outworn, and every use is being made of labour, machinery, and the extensive resources of civil enginerring.

results.title: The Task ahead
results.brief_description: The peoples of the world want food, they want technical resources, they want scientific knowledge and above all they want peace. The film traces the history of UNESCO (United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organisation) and illustrates how, through this organisation, books, paintings and the tools of eduation are being supplied to the peoples of many lands.

results.title: The Tartans of Scotland
results.brief_description: Explains the evolution of the Scottish national costume from medieval times, showing the stages of its evolution. Discusses the origin of the modern clan tartans.

results.title: The Tap dance kid. - Edited version
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Evelyn Barron and Barra Grant
results.brief_description:
Eight year old Willie Sheridan has a single passion - dancing. His twelve-year-old sister Emma wants to be a lawyer. When Willie, with Emma’s help, gets a chance to audition for summer stock, the entire family confronts the conflict between parents wishes and children’s dreams.
Edited version based on the book “Nobody’s family is going to change” by Louise Fitzhugh.

results.title: The Tao of Steve
results.creator_credit: Thunderhead Productions, Anthony Bregman and Jenniphr Goodman
results.brief_description: Santa Fe primary school teacher Dex (Donal Logue) is a success with the ladies and he owes it all to Steve - Steve Austin, Steve McQueen, Steve McGarrett - the prototypical cool American male, he never has to impress the women but always gets the ladies. Dex and his entourage of single male friends (one is happily married), subscribe to the tao of Steve, valuing such ideals as suppressing that which you desire and doing something excellent in front of the ladies. Dex’s comfortable, philandering existence is thrown into turmoil when he meets Syd (Greer Goodman) - a conquest from his thinner, college years - whom, to his surprise, he discovers he is falling in love with, causing him to question the code by which he has lived his life thus far. A surprise sleeper at the 2000 Sundance Film Festival, Goodman’s directorial debut saw Donal Logue awarded with a Special Jury Prize.

results.title: The Tank Gang: A Say No to Bullies Story
results.creator_credit: Ruben Durrand, Tahalia Durrand and Willem Durrand
results.brief_description: This is the story of the Tank Gang. The Tank Gang love playing together, even with Jack, the bully. One day, Jack goes too far and the Tank Gang see how putting up with Jack has meant that their friend got hurt. The friends all learn the importance of standing up for each other, not bullying and being good friends.

results.title: The Tango lesson [DVD]
results.creator_credit: OKCK Films, PIE, Neue Deutsche Filmgesellschaft, Christopher Sheppard and Sally Potter
results.brief_description: Filmmaker Sally Potter returns to her dancing roots (‘The Golddiggers’ was her first musical) by casting herself as a film director suffering from writer’s block who sets out to take tango lessons from a Paris-based teacher (Pablo Veron, playing himself). Veron has always dreamed of being in a movie and Sally is starting to dream of a film about tango. Potter’s film is divided into twelve lessons during which the two protagonists learn about each other, fight over who is leading who, start a love story, and eventually end up in Buenos Aires to learn from the tango masters. The film is shot mostly in black and white, except for some dream sequences in which Sally fantasizes about an ill-fated film project. Veron performs many modern dance numbers, including tap and ballroom dancing, as part of his tango repertoire.
